subtitle: Help! She cries all night and sleeps all day!
description: Help! She cries all night and sleeps all day!
title: YoungMother
content:
At the hospital my baby did not cry much. It started when we got home. She
cried right through that first night. I was breastfeeding her fine, I had no
problem with that. I knew which positions to use. The nurses had shown me at
the clinic. But she just cried all night, every night. She would sleep all day
and cry all night. I came to fear the nights. She screamed like she was in
pain. I couldn’t leave her alone. I sat with her all night. It would tear my
heart apart. I thought I would go mad from lack of sleep. Other moms tell me I
should have done things differently. I should have kept her awake during the
day to make her more tired at night. Or I should have just left her to cry.
But I was 18 at the time and all I just did the best I could. Then when she
reached 6 months, the crying stopped. That was the first time I started to
enjoy being a mother! She turns 2 this year and she is doing well! And I am
doing well. The early days were hard. But we both got through it all okay!
**MAMA HELP: Every baby is different but all babies cry. Listening to your
baby cry for hours can make you worried, even angry. You may not be able to
stop him from crying. But remain calm and do your best to soothe him until he
settles down. If you know he is not hungry, tired, wet or in pain, get a
second opinion from someone you trust. Together you can decide if your baby
needs to see a doctor.**
